title.narrative: The National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project (PAMSIMAS 2)

description.narrative: The World Bank project The National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project (PAMSIMAS II) is a national Government of Indonesia (GoI) program partially funded by a World Bank and co-financed by Government of Australia. Through community-driven approaches, PAMSIMAS aims to increase access to low-income and underserved rural and peri-urban populations to improved water and sanitation facilities and improved hygiene behaviour and has been identified by GoI as its primary program for achieving GoI's MDG water and sanitation targets in rural areas. PAMSIMAS has benefited approximately 4.2 million people with improved access to water and 3 million access to sanitation. In January 2013, AusAID was requested by GoI to provide support to PAMSIMAS-2. PAMSIMAS-2 will be implemented in 5,000 villages across Indonesia, benefiting approximately 5.6 million people to access clean water and 4.9 million people to access sanitation. PAMSIMAS-2 will also make significant contributions to the aid prog
